features: 🚘【UHD 4K Dash Cam】✅Cosuvow dash camera for cars is equipped with an advanced starvis sensor and 6-glass lens to capture every detail of your driving with Ultra HD 3840x2160p/30fps resolution. ✅WDR and Night Vision maintain video clarity and color accuracy day and night. ✅It is your ideal mini dashcam for cars, trucks and SUVs.

🚘【WiFi-APP Control】✅The exquisite dash camera comes with an APP for iOS and Android smartphones, you can easily view live footage, replay recordings, download videos, change settings, edit and share your footage. ✅Share videos to social platforms with just a tap of your fingers, allowing you to share any journey with friends or family.

🚘【G-Sensor and Loop Recording】✅The car camera will automatically start recording a 15-second video when it detects a collision or shaking, which can provide valuable evidence in the event of an accident (hardwire kit required). ✅When the memory card reaches the storage limit, new videos will automatically overwrite the oldest videos.

🚘【Fashionable Mini Design】✅The mini hidden design will not block your sight while driving, maximizing the safety of you and your car. ✅The dash cam front can be adjusted up or down 15° to get the best view of the road. ✅Operating temperature is -50°F to 140°F. ✅Comes with an excellent user manual, making installation and setup easy and convenient.

🚘【24H Parking Monitor and Time-Lapse】✅Cosuvow dash cam 4k provides 24-hour parking monitoring, automatically recording and capturing any potential events around the vehicle (hardwire kit required). ✅Time-lapse records continuously with low power consumption and low frame rate, protecting the vehicle from theft or vandalism.

🚘【Free 32G SD Card】✅The car dash cam includes a free 32GB SD card, which supports memory cards with capacities up to 128GB, ensuring that your videos have sufficient storage space. ✅Your 4k dashcam comes with a 24-month warranty and a 30-day full refund policy, and our dedicated customer support team is here to help you resolve any issues.

Q: The camera cannot connect to the app and shows Connection Failed? A: Please remember to authorize the App with photo albums, location, WLAN and cellular data, and turn off the VPN, security software and anti-virus software on your phone, otherwise the connection will fail. Q: Can't record/tape? A: Please use a genuine Class 10 or above high speed card. Check whether the memory card is installed correctly. The memory card needs to be formatted on the APP when it is first inserted into the camera. Q: Is it bluetooth/wireless? A: The S1 dash camera is neither bluetooth nor wireless. You need to connect the power cable that comes with the package to use it. Q: Can I watch live video when the app is not connected to WiFi? A: When the app is not connected to the recorder WiFi, it is not possible to watch live video, you can only view downloaded and saved video files in the app. Q: Having other problems? A: If you encounter any problems, you can directly submit them in the "Feedback" page of the app, so that our technicians can help you deal with the problems and make improvements at the first time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Perfect budget discreet dash cam
reviews.reviewText: This is the perfect dashcam if you want something you can set up and forget about it until you need it. No annoying visible light emitted at all, which is very nice for driving at night. No GPS either and you can turn off the speaker and all sound recording.Setup is very simple and intuitive. Somehow the dash cam knows the correct time and date even the right time zone without having to be set. I have no idea how it does this.I did not use the included micro SD card because it is only 32gb.The only negatives to this dash cam are universal to all 2.4ghz wifi dash cams.1. If you have wireless Apple CarPlay you can initially connect to the dash cam but it is going to constantly disconnect and reconnect to CarPlay.2. Video download is painfully slow on a 2.4 ghz WiFi connection.My workaround to both these problems was to buy a microSD card reader that plugs into my phone. Works flawlessly whenever I want to review footage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product. Easy to install and use.
reviews.reviewText: Camera came with everything, as described. It’s easy to install, set up and begin using immediately. Clear video and the app is easy to navigate. Definitely worth the price, for the peace of mind of knowing you can have a video record to prevent any “misunderstandings” if someone causes an accident.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to install
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install, free SD card. Wires easily hidden in Hyundai Sante Fe Sport. However, recording time of 3 min could be longer. The app is easy to use too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works like a charm!
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with my purchase of my Cosuvow Dash Cam. It’s very easy to operate through their app. I highly recommended! Picture quality is amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product at low price
reviews.reviewText: I bought this dash cam for my son last month in light of its design and specifications, works well so far. No complaints!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Does not work. says video is locked tried many times. Junk

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not wireless, difficult to install on some cars
reviews.reviewText: The technology may be good, but the installation is a mess. Must be plugged into the car's cigarette lighter outlet, which means you will be running a wire across the top of your windshield, down the side and back across the dashboard. There are instructions for how to tuck it into the trim, but it takes longer than it should. Also a problem is fitting it on a windshield that comes with the upper part blackened for vehicle advanced features. Because you need to attach it to a clear space, that means you'll be putting it far enough down to partially block the driver's view. And, you will have an ugly wire reaching down from the top of your windshield. Doesn't work with my car, but your results may differ especially if you have a more basic or older model car.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a handy dash cam. good app and included micro SD card.

reviews.reviewTitle: ✨Simplified Excellence with Crystal-Clear Recording, Great App, Protection on the Road & Parking
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I recently took the Cosuvow 4K Front Dash Cam for a spin, and the simplicity coupled with its powerful features left me thoroughly impressed. This dash camera doesn't rely on complicated controls or voice commands; instead, it boasts a straightforward one-button operation and a great app (named Viitdure) that allows me to set up settings, and see/download/share media easily! It has crystal clear 4K resolution (3840 x 2160P resolution at 30fps), and stable WiFi that connects to my cell reliably. No need for a Dash Camera display since I have my app helping me to see media and adjust all settings! Brilliant design ✨✨The absence of voice control might seem like a drawback to some, but the simplicity of the design is where the magic lies. One button is all it takes to start it or lock manually the recording, making it incredibly user-friendly. When I turn it on, the recording starts automatically, and the voice announces "Start Recording". When I stop recording from the app, the voice announces: "Stop Recording". While the voice has a hint of robotic charm, it serves a practical purpose. The dash cam diligently announces when the video recording starts or stops, providing a helpful audio cue. This feature, although seemingly minor, is a game-changer. It ensures that I'm always aware of the camera's status, adding an extra layer of convenience to the overall experience. I would recommend a more pleasant/clear voice though :)🎥🔊 Now, let's talk about the settings:- Video resolution: 4K or 2K;- Loop recording duration: 1min, 2min, 3min;- Timestamp and audio recording can be set up on/off, and speaker volume adjusted;- COLLISION SENSING: this can be set up as Low, Medium, or High; it will lock the video at the time of the collision. I always prefer to set it up on a medium;- Time-lapse Video FPS: 1sec, 2 sec, 3 sec - 1FPS (frame per sec) is the most memory saving option;- The WiFi name will be displayed as S1-20230823 - and connect automatically- Camera file management: very simple - keeps files in 4 categories: Loop, Snapshot, Locked, and Parking; I can delete, or download as I wish.✨The 4K image quality, day or night, is as stunning as ever, capturing every detail with precision. The "Viidure" app continues to impress with its intuitive controls, allowing me to manage the dash cam effortlessly from my smartphone. The inclusion of the 24 Hours Parking feature, G-Sensor, WDR (Wide Dynamic Range), Loop Recording, and the bonus 32GB card make this dash cam a comprehensive and reliable choice.In conclusion, the Cosuvow Dash Cam 4K Front strikes a perfect balance between simplicity and functionality. It's a no-fuss solution for those who appreciate a straightforward approach to recording their journeys. The robotic charm of the voice announcements adds character to the experience, making it a dash cam that is effective and keeps me in control. I recommend it, and I will keep in mind this brand for future products 🚗✨

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple DashCam Works as it Should
reviews.reviewText: When I initially ordered this item the title had said Wireless 4k Dashcam and what I have is not that. This product does not feature a rechargeable battery or any type of battery and therefore comes with a long power cable that needs to be wrapped around your windshield and down into the port. Some of its selling features like the 24 hr surveillance and 15 second auto recording actually need a “hardwire kit”. Is that the power cord it comes with or something else, I don't even know. So I can only review the most basic of dash cams. And it's fine. The size is okay, small and discreet. The video quality is decent, not a true 4k really but it's not grainy or pixelated. I love that the company included a 32g miniSD because these can be expensive. Though I don’t love that it needs to be formatted on a computer first since none of mine have the miniSD port and I need to buy the adapter first. The adhesive it comes with is great, it's held up in direct sunlight and -15 temps without peeling or falling off. The price for it is okay, pretty comparable for other basic cams.

reviews.reviewTitle: Native 4K camera sensor for sharp videos and powered by USB Type C
reviews.reviewText: This camera is simple to operate using a one-touch button to power on/off and built-in voice speaker which indicates recording status. It's also one of the biggest drawbacks since the camera lacks LCD screen, positioning lens angle can be difficult without having to rely on a smartphone app to preview live stream, check recordings, or change settings over WiFi.// 4K SensorNight vision performance is decent for city driving in well illuminated areas being visible but at a high noise and artifact ratio while darker areas are hard to see due to the high level of contrast on this camera sensor. In daytime the 4k footage outperforms in clarity making plate numbers as far away as 15 to 20 feet readable while stationary and capturing ultrawide angle in detail. There is motion blur from its low 30 FPS frame rate which mostly affects the side edges of camera footage in fast moving scenarios.Internally the camera PCB has markings for native 8MP sensor for clear 4K30 resolution and built-in MicroSD card slot as the only recording mechanism. It does have a Realtek WiFi N chipset outputting limited signal range of about 10ft in open areas or limited to inside vehicles.// PowerPowered by USB Type C not only does this camera work great for driving with decent low-light performance but I've used it flexibly like an action camera or capturing time-lapses at 1 to 3 FPS on its wide angle lens.Although it simply lacks any kind of built-in battery or super capacitor meaning the camera instantly powers off along with the car degrading last few frames of video captured. The included 12V car adapter has a 5V at 1 Amp DC converter with a lengthy USB Type C cable which I was able to hide behind side panels for simple installation.// StorageLive picture stream inside the app only shows preview at low SD 960x544 resolution and requires manually copying 4K footage from MicroSD card to a PC to get full 4K. Included memory card is small 32GB capacity that quickly fills up within an hour of recording because of high bitrate of uncompressed 4K stream but can be configured inside camera settings to 2K resolution.Overall this WiFi camera has sharp 4K videos at 30 FPS on its native 8MP sensor while being easy to configure with single button operation and comes with 32GB MicroSD card capacity to store captured footage.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Compact Guardian for Your Journeys
reviews.reviewText: The Cosuvow Car Dash Cam is a remarkable addition to the world of automotive safety, providing a compact yet powerful solution for capturing every moment on the road. Titled as a 4K Wireless Mini Front Dash Camera, this device boasts a range of features that make it a reliable companion for drivers seeking enhanced security and peace of mind.The 4K resolution ensures crisp and clear footage, allowing you to capture even the smallest details with precision. The wireless functionality adds convenience to the installation process, eliminating the need for cumbersome cables and making setup a breeze. This feature is particularly useful for those who prefer a clean and organized interior.One standout feature of the Cosuvow Dash Cam is its 24 Hours Parking mode, offering continuous surveillance even when your vehicle is stationary. The G-Sensor technology detects sudden movements or impacts, triggering automatic recording to capture incidents such as accidents or vandalism. This ensures that your car is protected, whether you're driving or parked.The Wide Dynamic Range (WDR) and Night Vision technologies enhance the camera's performance in various lighting conditions. WDR ensures balanced exposure, minimizing glare and shadow, while Night Vision guarantees clear footage in low-light situations. This makes the Cosuvow Dash Cam a reliable companion for both day and night driving.The Loop Recording feature ensures that you never miss a moment, as the camera automatically overwrites the oldest footage when the memory card reaches its capacity. The inclusion of a free 32GB card provides ample storage for your recordings, giving you peace of mind without the need for immediate upgrades.In conclusion, the Cosuvow Car Dash Cam impresses with its 4K resolution, wireless convenience, and a comprehensive set of features including 24 Hours Parking mode, G-Sensor, WDR, Loop Recording, and Night Vision. It's a compact guardian for your journeys, offering enhanced security and capturing every detail on the road. Whether you're a daily commuter or a road-trip enthusiast, the Cosuvow Dash Cam is a worthy investment in your vehicle's safety.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good stable dashcam that will do the job
reviews.reviewText: This Cosuvow Car Dash Cam despite the lack of details in the listing a very decent camera to have at a good price. It is surprisingly better at some things than other dashcams. It uses an adhesive sticker instead of suction cup (you also get an extra adhesive pad, just in case). I hate suction cups, they end up falling all the time, especially when there is a big swing of temperatures. It can record audio and video up to 4K. Personally, I just went with 2K (1440p) as I found it more manageable quality wise and storage wise. The dashcam has a good manual included that explains all the things that you need to know. Surprisingly, a 32GB generic no name SD card is included. It is surprising, as most dashcams do not include an SD card. The SD is not the best, but it will get the job done. The dashcam connects with a USB-C, which is always a good advantage in case the original cable does not work anymore. The camera will announce every time it starts or stops recording, an extremely useful feature to avoid any surprises. The app is decent and does the job as intended. A 2 min video at 2K resolution will take about 260MB of SD storage.There are a few things that I hope it gets fixed in a software update. The camera announcement voice is not very loud, and if there is any external noise, you will have no idea what it just said. The camera angle adjuster is really stiff, and it could be really hard to just adjust it a little bit. The camera app can lag a little bit, and cause some settings to not register.Overall, this dashcam impressed me with some nice features, and I certainly would hope to see more functions added to it.
